A good free mod is to pull the spring out of the carb and chop a few coils off. I think 11 is the magic number but do some research to be safe. This improves throttle response, makes it more peppy i guess. Never personally done it tho.
I had it on a rancher 350 and it was really good, 2wd handles better, and is more fun on solid ground.
I have a white brothers e series on my 400 and it is pretty great i think.
Throttle cable, shouldn't be too bad

The truth is most everything will do you well, except the Chinese stuff, im a hardcore honda guy and i love the rancher 350s and i have a 400ex now which is awesome, just get something in good shape that has the features you want.
I always thought about taking a missile kit from the old trikes and putting it on a quad and making something like that.

What type of riding do you like to do? Do you like to go fast, or do you like mudding or crawling? My previous bike was a honda 350 4x4 and my current bike is a 400ex 2x4, and both types are a blast, but do ride quite different. My favorite thing about my new bike vs my old one is the amount of customisation you can do to a 2x4 vs a 4x4. If you want to hit really rough terrain and go anywheres, get a 4x4, and if you want to stay on the trails and go fast, get a 2x4. Technical terrain is also fun on the 2x4.
Is this hand done? I once saw a filter that looked like that. Either way looks sick, i have a pile of good atv pics that would look good like that
I have the headlights and the headlight trim, but no bike they fit on lol, have them as spare parts for my 05
A 300ex or a 400ex is an awesome bike as well!
Im 5'11" and 130 and i ride a 400ex
That would be really cool, i like the older looking bikes. i want to paint mine up red white and blue like the old honda 250r's
If your friends have 2x4s i'd get one too.
Super duper bike!
Well if your friends drive the sport quads they'll likely go fast and stay away from the mud, you just wont get the use of 4x4, in my experience at least.
And for that sort of riding the 2x4 bikes just handle better and are more fun.
Big crew and nice view

WRITING.TITLE: Best Canadian website
WRITING.TEXT: What is the best Canadian website to order atv parts from? I need chain, guides, a sprocket and a air filter. Fortnine seems the best so far.
I had looked there and they had very few parts for sport atv's, seems to have lots of accessories though
Well the older ones both had solid rear axles, dct is automatic and es is just manual with a thumb button controled shift motor, the Rubicon footshift is quite new
I often order from rocky mountain, its American, but it has the best selection and good prices too, and they ship to Canada. Expect it to be a little more expensive though.

WRITING.TITLE: Making the most of the snow and free time

WRITING.TEXT: Sydney seagulls are wack, I visited and i couldn't believe it, i wore a ballcap just to swat them.

Depends on the terrain you plan on riding on, pump them up if you're riding on smooth hard surfaces, and let air out for more traction. I usually run 2.5-3psi, for dirt and gravel, but i let some out for snow
Nice foot

WRITING.TITLE: Hopefully there will be a bit more bite to the tires next time, can't feel the pull in the snow

WRITING.TEXT: Always list for $500 more than you want, or even more. I had a vehicle i wanted $2000 out of, and i listed it for $2200 for months and couldn't get an offer more than $1500, so i reposted it at $2800 and had it gone within days. People like to think they're getting a steal.

A heavy miner, for names, look at names of old famous ships or for a mining ship maybe the name of a famous mine. I find names this way, its fun to read about your ship's namesake too. Parody names are cool too. I have a green and yellow buggy called the jim moose and a yellow escavator named dog.

WRITING.TITLE: Which moon is the best?
WRITING.TEXT: What is everyone's preferred moon and why? I have yet to build a moon base or even land on a moon, and would like to try.

I use different colours for different types of vehicles and bases. My combat ships are mainly white and blue, my miners and any other industrial vehicles are grey and yellow or orange, and my exploration/cargo vehicles are grey and green. Maroon and white also looks really good. Rusty yellow or orange looks really good for anything industrial.
I know i should get riding boots, but I've been wearing old tight fitting leather shoes, not the safest, but i figure they're fine as long as you have nerf bars
Use it, that gn4 stuff has never let me down.
Your shifter must be stiff, i drive a 400ex and i have no issues with toe support, I've even driven it barefoot before and been fine. (Just putting it away after washing it)
Greg says "BRUH"

WRITING.TITLE: Saw a post about hyperspace rings, so i built one, and it works pretty good

WRITING.TEXT: Its a ring of jump drives to connect a ship to
Solar panels and batteries, takes a while to charge lol
Rotors and blast doors
The idea is it'll charge while im doing stuff on a planet, if it takes too long I'll figure something else out.
I haven't found out yet, im gonna go to titan and mine a ton of platinum and see if its charged by the time j get back

So on one charge it can get to any planet or moon in the system, and back from any other. My current project is a main space station near Europa, so i plan to use this drive to go from the station to anywheres and back, and then charge it at the station
What is the trick?
